CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mary Holley, 7128 Race Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 21, 1957, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that the proposed six-day-a-week school attendance, as proposed by Governor Leader, is the answer to the Russian challenge in scientific education?" answer reads: "No, I don't. I think that it would not give the kids time enough to do things for themselves.  If extra time is needed, I would prefer the addition of more hours to the school day.  Perhaps the kids could begin an half hour earlier each day and stay later in the evenings."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Holley, wearing eyeglasses, scarf, and light colored coat with contrasting collar, standing in front of light colored marble pillar between store windows displaying jewelry with sign reading "y b", and decorative ceramics
